title: MS AccessInt()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessInt()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the integer part of a number:
SELECT Int(756.43) AS IntNum;

Definition and Usage
The Int() function returns the integer part of a number.
Note:
If
number
is negative, this function returns 
the first negative integer less than or equal to
number
.
Syntax
Int(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the integer part of the "Price" column:
SELECT Int(Price) AS IntNum FROM Products;

❯
★
+1

quiz.question:
What is If
number?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If
number is 'negative'.

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessInt()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessInt()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessInt()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
